terms.definition: Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted by a service provider and accessed via the internet
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to see revision history and revert to previous versions
Standard Operating Procedures - detailed written instructions that describe how to perform routine tasks or processes consistently
A feature that allows multiple users to simultaneously edit and collaborate on the same document in real-time
A security approach that restricts system access and permissions based on a user's role or job function within an organization
Food and Drug Administration - the U.S. federal agency responsible for regulating and supervising the safety of drugs, medical devices, and biotechnology products
European Medicines Agency - the European Union's regulatory body responsible for the evaluation and supervision of medicinal products
Good Manufacturing Practice - a system of quality assurance ensuring that products are consistently produced according to quality standards
The process of teams from different departments or specialties working together to achieve common goals and share information
Structured lists of requirements or tasks that must be completed to meet regulatory standards and ensure adherence to rules
Official documents submitted to regulatory agencies that contain data and information required for product approval or compliance
The process of quickly locating and accessing specific documents from a storage system or database
A system where all documents and information are stored in a single, accessible location rather than scattered across multiple systems
The state of having all necessary documentation, processes, and systems prepared and easily accessible for regulatory inspections
